metadata.title: NBA CBA Study Materials - Batch 10: Article XXII - Health & Wellness
metadata.importance: HIGH - Critical for player health and safety

studyNote: Article XXII focuses specifically on player health, medical care, injury protocols, and wellness programs. Agents must understand medical rights, second opinion procedures, and mental health resources.

questions.question: Do players have the right to seek a second medical opinion?
questions.explanation: Players have the right to seek a second medical opinion at the team's expense for any injury or medical condition.

questions.question: Can teams require players to see specific doctors?
options: Yes, must use team physicians only
Players must see team doctors but can get second opinions
questions.explanation: Teams can require initial evaluation by team physicians, but players retain the right to seek independent second opinions.

questions.question: What is the 'Fitness-to-Play Panel'?
options: Independent doctors who resolve disputes about player health status
questions.explanation: The Fitness-to-Play Panel consists of independent physicians who resolve disputes between players and teams regarding fitness to play.

questions.question: Who pays for the Fitness-to-Play Panel evaluation?
questions.explanation: The cost of Fitness-to-Play Panel evaluations is shared equally by the NBA and NBPA.

questions.question: Can a player refuse treatment recommended by team doctors?
options: No, must follow team medical advice
Yes, but may affect contract guarantees
Only if they have a second opinion supporting refusal
questions.explanation: Players can refuse treatment, but doing so against medical advice may impact contract guarantees and team obligations.

questions.question: Are teams required to have a mental health professional on staff?
options: Yes, each team must have access to mental health services
questions.explanation: All teams are required to provide players with access to mental health professionals and counseling services.

questions.question: Is mental health counseling confidential?
options: Yes, strictly confidential unless player consents
Teams know diagnosis but not details
questions.explanation: Mental health counseling is strictly confidential and cannot be shared with teams without explicit player consent.

questions.question: What is the 'Concussion Protocol'?
options: Mandatory evaluation and clearance procedures for head injuries
questions.explanation: The Concussion Protocol establishes mandatory evaluation steps and independent clearance requirements before players can return after head injuries.

questions.question: Can players return to play the same day after a concussion?
options: No, must sit out minimum time period
questions.explanation: Players diagnosed with concussions must sit out and cannot return the same day, regardless of symptom resolution. Independent clearance is required.

questions.question: Who must clear a player to return from concussion protocol?
questions.explanation: An independent neurological consultant, not affiliated with any team, must clear players to return from concussion protocol.

questions.question: Are teams required to have athletic trainers?
options: Yes, certified athletic trainers must be on staff
questions.explanation: All teams must employ certified athletic trainers to provide immediate medical care and injury prevention.

questions.question: Can players access medical records from team physicians?
options: Yes, players have full access to their medical records
questions.explanation: Players have unrestricted access to all their medical records and can request copies at any time.

questions.question: What happens if team and player doctors disagree on injury treatment?
questions.explanation: When team and player physicians disagree on treatment or fitness to play, the Fitness-to-Play Panel makes the final determination.

questions.question: Are teams required to provide nutrition services?
questions.explanation: Teams must provide players with access to sports nutritionists and nutritional counseling services.

questions.question: Can players be required to take performance baseline tests?
options: Yes, baseline cognitive and physical testing is required
Only for players with injury history
questions.explanation: Players must undergo baseline cognitive testing (for concussion comparison) and physical assessments to establish health benchmarks.

questions.question: What is 'load management' in the context of player health?
options: Strategic rest to prevent injury and manage workload
questions.explanation: Load management refers to strategically resting players to prevent injury, though teams must balance this with fan expectations and league rules.

questions.question: Are teams required to have physical therapy equipment?
options: Yes, comprehensive training and rehab facilities required
questions.explanation: All teams must maintain comprehensive training rooms with physical therapy equipment and qualified staff.

questions.question: Can players challenge a team's injury report designation?
questions.explanation: Players can challenge injury report designations through the medical dispute resolution process if they disagree with the team's assessment.

questions.question: What is the 'Wellness Program'?
options: Comprehensive program covering physical, mental, and emotional health
questions.explanation: The Wellness Program provides comprehensive resources for physical health, mental health, emotional wellbeing, and lifestyle management.

questions.question: Are retired players eligible for continued medical monitoring?
options: Yes, for players with 3+ years of service
questions.explanation: Players with at least 3 years of service can access continued medical monitoring and health screenings in retirement through NBA programs.
